sentences.en: But instead of being incandescent, Mr Gold was more civil than before.
sentences.cn: 但与之前的激动相比,戈尔德这次变得比原来有礼貌了.

sentences.en: CFL Light Bulbs use about 25 % less energy than an incandescent bulb.
sentences.cn: 节能灯灯泡使用节能灯泡比白炽灯少25%左右.

sentences.en: Energy saving equivalent to 6 times life span of an incandescent lamp.
sentences.cn: 外观优美,节能省电,寿命长达白炽灯的6倍.

sentences.en: Fluorescent lamps are cooler and more efficient than incandescent lamps.
sentences.cn: 萤光灯较白炽灯省电且发热少.

sentences.en: Gill had an extraordinary, incandescent personality.
sentences.cn: 吉尔个性鲜明，热情洋溢。

sentences.en: It makes me incandescent with fury.
Lead in linear incandescent lamps with silicate coated tubes.
sentences.cn: 第16点:管状白炽灯硅酸盐涂层灯管中的铅.

sentences.en: Repetitive voltage fluctuations cause brightness variations in incandescent elements.
sentences.cn: 反复的电压波动引起白炽灯光度的变化.

sentences.en: The embers were still incandescent although the flames had disappeared.
sentences.cn: 尽管火焰已灭,余烬仍然炽热.

sentences.en: The incandescent lamp we use in daily life was invented by Edison.
sentences.cn: 我们日常生活中用的白炽灯，是爱迪生发明的。

sentences.en: The incandescent quality of his words illuminated the courage of his countrymen.
sentences.cn: 他炽热的语言点燃了他本国同胞的勇气.

sentences.en: the invention of the incandescent lamp
The light an electric lamp comes from an incandescent filament.
The sun blazed down from an incandescent sky.
The trees in the Embankment garden stood bulky against the incandescent Sky - line.
sentences.cn: 河堤花园里的树木背衬着灯光燃炽的夜空巍巍屹立.

sentences.en: They are called incandescent lights, and their colour depends on how hot they are.
sentences.cn: 这种灯叫做白炽灯，其颜色取决于温度。

words.tran_cn: 辉耀的；炽热的；发白热光的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 白炽灯泡，白炽灯照

trans.tran_cn: <术>白热的，白炽的，<正>十分明亮的，<正>感情强烈的
trans.tran_en: producing a bright light when heated
